channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned blue recycling bin, 4th November
item.description:
A damaged blue Southwark recycling bin has been abandoned adjacent to 2 Everthorpe Road for about 3 weeks.

item.title: Leafs creating slip hazzard, 4th November
item.description:
Lots of leafs on both sides of Plough Way again, which will need clearing given the high number of pedestrians and the associated increased likelihood of slip hazzards in wet weather.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Plough Way, Rotherhithe, London

item.description:

item.title: Rubnish, 4th November
item.description:
Road is covered with wet leafs, rubbish etc. Not very good for tge upcoming Remembrance parade from All Saints church rectory Lane to Foots Cray war memorial on 9th November. Could it be cleared prior to that please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Lane, North Cray, London

item.title: Paving slabs broken up in last 2 wekks, 4th November
item.description:
The paving slabs are completely broken up into pieces and form a serious trip hazard for all ages! They were in one piece before all the building work started 75 S-wood Road but obvs can't withstand constant transit vans and skip lorries (skip was in front space). Its about time the Council took photos of pavements prior to renovation works taking place on ALL residential property so that the householder/contractor pays for repairs - not all of us!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Southwood Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead Fox, 4th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clock House Road, Elmers End, London

item.title: Potholes and uneven pavements - lowman road, dunford road and jackson road, 4th November
item.description:
Good morning, In addition to the huge pothole in the middle of the road on Lowman Road, there are several potholes throughout the road. A cyclist fell yesterday and it is very impractical for wheelchair users. In addition, the same issues apply on Dunford Road and Jackson Road. Lastly, on these three streets the pavements are extremely uneven, again making it difficult to walk or use a wheelchair. This has been going on for years and definitely has not been fixed since I moved to Lowman Road last year so please could the council look into it and fix it properly once and for all. Thank you. Best
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-25, Lowman Road, Holloway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 4th November
item.description:
I have reported this drain 3 times and each time been told it is fixed but it isn’t. Every time it rains the drain overflows. It is blocked. Please do not say it has been cleared when it hasnt!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkhurst Road, Brunswick Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
